definition[0]: a bed for a baby or young child, with bars on the side to stop the baby from falling out
definition[1]: a bed with high sides for a very young baby, which you can move gently from side to side
definition[2]: a wooden frame in which you put food for animals such as cows and horses
definition[3]: a model of the scene of Jesus Christ’s birth, often placed in churches and homes at Christmas
definition[4]: a book or piece of paper with information or answers to questions, which students sometimes use dishonestly in examinations
example[0]: I’m not at my crib, I’m at Jed’s house.
definition[7]: to copy school or college work dishonestly from someone else
example[1]: He didn’t want anyone to crib the answers from him.
